column1: back of a length and swerves outside off, left alone
even shorter and outside off, Tamim attempts a slash and does not connect
Tamim races down the track for a big hack, the bowler shortens his length and defeats the batsman
left alone outside off now
bouncer outside off, sails over the hook. Wide called
back  of a length and outside off, punched sweetly through the covers
worked to midwicket for one
veering into the pads, flicked down to long leg
short and skids on middle, hangs back and fends it back to the bowler

length and angling away outside off, Kayes attempts a low-percentage slog across the line. He only manages a thick outside edge, which is gleefully snapped up by the keeper to his left. The batsman did not move his feet and simply swing wildly. Kayes then walked off, umpire Haig did not have to raise his finger
short and down the leg side, left alone
back of a length and angled in on off, skids in, punchily played to the covers
fractionally short and outside off, Sabbir, who is standing outside the crease, reads the length early. Steps back and pulls in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
very full on middle and leg, no lateral shape, tip-and-run single in front of midwicket
very full and swings back into the right-hander, who is caught on the crease. He squirts an inside-edge onto the pad and gets away
very full and angling away outside off from over the wicket, slices a drive to backward point
Wheeler shortens his length on off stump, Sabbir quietly blocks it back to the bowler
pretty full and just a shade outside off, Sabbir shuffles across, aims a dinky scoop, but the ball goes only as far as midwicket
short and angling away outside off, Sabbir arches his back and ramps it to third man
that's the first six in T20 internationals in 2017. Full and outside off, Sabbir sizes it up and launches it into the stands beyond midwicket
length and straightens away outside off, Sabbir sticks his bat out and is beaten
short and outside off, swatted away to the right of mid-on
good length on off, presses forward and plays it back to the bowler
very full and outside off, Tamim carves a drive past backward point, third man, who is rather square hunts the ball down
the contact is high on the bat, which means no timing, but enough to clear mid-on. Short of a length and outside off, pulled over mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Tamim eyes a big leg-side swipe. The bails flies off a top edge, lands fine of deep third man
short and outside off, leaps off the surface and messes with the left-hander's cut. Chopped away to point
half-volley just outside off, right in the hitting radar. Stands tall, throws the bat at the ball, and drills the ball straight of mid-on

The debutants - Bruce and Wheeler - combine for the dismissal of Tamim. Banged in short and outside off, shoulder-high delivery. Tamim attempts a hook, although he does not get on top of the ball. Skies a catch to square-ish long leg. Bruce snaffles it
Shakib gets on top of this short ball outside off, cut away through backward point
leg-stump ball, turned through square leg

The third debutant joins the party. Ferguson strikes with his first ball on his T20I debut. This wasn't a wicket-taking delivery by any means, though. Rank full-toss on off stump, Sabbir should have swatted it over the mid-on. Instead, he spoons a waist-high catch to the fielder. Soft ball, soft dismissal

two wickets off his first two balls on T20 international debut. This is a peach from Ferguson. This was a wicket-taking delivery alright. 148ks. Good length, angling away, swings away and bounces at the batsman. Soumya wafts at the ball with his feet stapled to the crease. Grazes the outside edge and loops into the hands of gully. Soumya begins 2017 with a golden duck
and he averts the hat-trick. 147ks ripping yorker at the base of off stump, the batsman crouches and jams it how. Somehow jams it out
146.2ks bouncer, angled into the right-hander. He sways his upper body out of the way. Whizzes past the grille
full and in the channel outside off, left alone
short and rises outside off, Mahmudullah arches his back and ramps it over backward point
good length on middle
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man
picked off the pads to long leg
dug in short, pulled away to deep square leg for one
good length on off, steered to point
full and outside off, front-foot drive to the covers
back of a length and just outside off, opens the face and glides the ball to point
Mahmudullah races down the track, the bowler hurls it short and beats the hook lavishly
full-toss outside off, possibly a slower ball, sliced away square through the off side
full on off, driven down to long-on
bouncer on middle, hits the deck, and flies off the surface over the ducking batsman, over the keeper. Five wides
full and outside off, tapped to the covers
low full-toss on the pads, flicked away to deep midwicket for a double
Mahmudullah charges down the track, the bowler shortens his length outside off. But Mahmudullah deals with it and clubs it in the air, clearing Munro at the deep square leg fence
back of a length and outside off, chopped down to third man
back of a length and rears up outside off, takes the outside edge and rolls down to third man
back of a length and outside off, punched sweetly to sweeper cover
glanced off the pads to long leg
length ball on off, whipped away to wide long-on
tapped into the covers
full and drifts in, nurdled into the vacant spaces at square leg
slower through the air outside off, Shakib goes low and sweeps it towards deep square leg
skids on faster, flatter, but not short. Shakib pulls and gets a bottom edge, ricochets off the pad and nearly kisses leg stump
length and outside off, guided to cover
clipped off the pads to long leg
full and outside off, driven down to long-on
dug in short and outside off, Shakib goes for the pull. He doesn't get on top of the ball either. He top-edges it in the air, Santner back-tracks from midwicket and settles under that skier
full and outside off, opens the face and runs the ball to point
full and outside off, jabbed to the covers
non-turning full ball outside off, which is driven through the covers
back of a length and skids in with the arm, worked to midwicket, and they pinch a single by the time Santner gets to the ball
pitched up and outside off, driven to cover
yorker on off, dug out
back of a length and outside off, late-cut to point
Santner bowls another fizzing yorker, outside off, beats the batsman for pace. It slid through to the keeper even before the bat came down. Smart work from Ronchi too
leg-side wide
full and outside off, opens the face and steers it to short third man
another leg-side wide
very full and outside off, carved down to third man
length and outside off, driven with an open face to sweeper cover
full on off, worked straight to midwicket
turned to the right of midwicket now
tossed outside off, driven to sweeper cover
flatter and angled in, whipped away through square leg
change of pace, very slow and outside off, cut and a miss
the batsman steps away outside leg, throws the bowler off track. Santner loses his head and sends down a middle-stump full-toss. Mosaddek smites it over midwicket
off-side wide now
slides on outside off, helped to short third man
stump-to-stump line, played back to Santner
short and outside off, cut to point
118.3 slower ball outside off, sliced to sweeper cover
Mosaddek launches it, again! He backs away outside leg, this is pretty full around off. He lifts it over cover with great authority
length and speared on middle, jabbed to cover
short and angled down the leg side, past the glance
and again, ill-directed down the leg side
very full and angled into the pads, whipped away through backward square leg
Mossadek backs away outside leg. Ferguson slips in a slower cutter wide outside off, well past the tramline
pretty full on the stumps, punched down the ground
nudged off the pads to short fine leg
off-stump yorker, dug to the covers

Holes out to cover-point. Anderson takes a good overhead catch. Tossed up slower, drifts in, and then turns away slightly. Mossadek eyes the leg side with a slog. He is not close enough to the pitch of the ball. Skies a leading edge to Anderson
short and turns away outside off, punched to point
slides in with the arm, back of a length, punched through cover
full turning ball outside off, Mashrafe aims a drive, slices an outside edge, which lands in front of point
slides it full and down leg, past Mahmudllah's glance
pitched up and outside off, sticks in the surface, Mahmudllah aims to bash it over cover. He skews an outside edge fine of third man
half-volley on off and middle, Mahmudullah punishes it. He belts it down the ground over long-on
length and outside off, Mahmudullah slashes and inside-edges it back to Henry
shortish and kicks up outside off, rides the bounce and glides it down to third man
banged in short, really short, Mashrafe aims a hook. The ball sails over the helmet. Wide
Henry gets his length right now. Yorker outside off, jammed out towards point
Another batsman perishes to a full-toss. Angling away outside off, Mashrafe wants to drill it over mid-off, who is inside the ring. He, however, mis-times it to cover moving to his right
low full-toss outside off, glided to sweeper cover
off-side wide
bouncer, angling away outside off, gets big on Mahmudullah. He bails out of the hook
wide yorker, tantalisingly close to being called a wide, Mahmudullah reaches out, but can't touch it. Or did he toe-end it behind
Wheeler slips another slower ball outside off, past the tramline
overpitched and outside off, Mahmudullah angles his bat and slices a four past backward point. Cleared his front leg and drove with a slicing finish
full and very wide outside off, would have been a wide had the batsman missed. Mahmudullah reaches out and carves it to point
full and outside off, leans forward, opens up his arms, and crashes it over mid-off, who is inside the circle
Mahmudullah races down the track, meets a shortish ball, and carves towards deep point
near yorker outside off, jabbed to third man with an angled bat
shortish on off, arches his back and rides it down to third man. Mahmudullah ended 2016 with 0,1,3. Opens 2017 with a half-century
the batsman shuffles across off, gets a short ball, attempts an ambitious scoop. But can't lay bat on ball
back of a length and outside off, sliced away in the air between sweeper cover and square third man
length ball on middle, hacks across the line, and outside-edges it to third man
cracking yorker. Slower dipping yorker, floors the leg stump. 118ks, dips late, zips under the bat and takes out the leg stump. End of a spunky innings nevertheless from Mahmudullah
nasty short ball, 145ks, angled in, Rubel fends at it and is smacked on the glove. Pace like fire
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and guides the ball to point
length ball on off, Nurul clears his front leg and slogs the ball to midwicket. Ungainly slog
pretty full, almost a yorker, angled in, Rubel crouches and jabs the ball towards midwicket
non-turning flat ball on off, hangs back and works through square leg
fractionally short on off, moves back and pulls it to the right of mid-on
short and slid in, punchily played to the leg side
whipped away to the right of the square leg umpire
looped up and outside off, Williamson twinkles down the track, meets the pitch, and majestically lofts the ball over mid-on, who is inside the circle
darted in short on off, Williamson hangs back, expecting it. Whipped to deep midwicket
Williamson welcomes his opposite number with a four. Full and angled in on off and middle, clipped away serenely to the right of midwicket
too full and straight, placed to the right of the leg umpire and to the left of short fine leg
length ball outside off, Williamson plays at the last possible moment. Angling his bat and dinking it down to third man with ultra-soft hands
full and angled in, diverted off the pads to the leg side, quite adjacent to the pitch
full and outside off, run down to third man for one
full offcutter on off, knocked back to Mashrafe
very full and outside off, opens the face, and steers the ball deftly to third man
fractionally short on off stump, picks it up and pulls it square of long leg. Very very wristy

Oh my! Terrific catch from Shakib. Excellent awareness at the edge of the boundary. Hip-high short ball outside off, Broom clatters a pull in the air off the middle of the bat. Shakib runs to his left from deep square leg, gets into a side-on position, the momentum carries him over the rope. He knows it and thus tosses the ball back into the field of play. He himself then springs back into the field of play and dives forward; sprawling dive to grasp the ball with both hands. That was the only part of the boundary with the rope as opposed to the ad board, and it worked in the favour of Shakib. Great reflexes from him, though
very full on middle and leg, Williamson eases it through midwicket. Flicked away
back of a length and angled in, the ball sticks in the surface, Williamson shuffles across and inside-edges the ball to the leg side
hip-high short ball outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length and angled in, played back to the bowler
Mustafiz has Munro nicking behind. Full and holds its line outside off, Munro chases the ball with a drive with no feet and offers a regulation catch to Nurul. Dolly catch
yorker, tails in, clipped to midwicket
full and outside off, cutter from Mustafiz, Anderson waited for the ball to arrive and then guided square through the off side
full and angling away outside off, late-cut away towards deep point
back of a length and skids in, Anderson falls over the flick and is rapped on the thigh. Bouncing over the top of the stumps
back of a length and outside off, 140.5ks, steered down to third man
short on off, Anderson rides the bounce and cuts the ball to third man
back of a length and outside off, pulled in the air, deep midwicket mops up
big swing and a miss outside off. Anderson's feet went nowhere
back of a length on off, rides the bounce and cuts late past backward point
half-volley on the pads, violently whipped to the midwicket boundary
back of a length and cuts back into Anderson, he manages an inside-edge onto the thigh. Whippy cutter, sticks in the surface
short and angled in around off, leans back and late-cuts it past short third man
slips a slower one down leg. Left alone
short and just outside off, check-punched through extra-cover
full and straight, clipped to mid-on
tossed outside off, shovelled away to midwicket. They hare across for the second
clipped from off stump into the vacant spaces at midwicket

Anderson picks out long-off to perfection. Tossed up outside off, angling away outside off from around the stumps. Anderson looks to hoick it over the midwicket region. Not a full-blooded hoick. The outside edge balloons all the way to long-off
uses his feet and dead-bats this very full ball
short, slid in with the arm, punched to midwicket
fractionally short and wide outside off, steps back and square-cuts away to deep point
full and angled in from over the wicket, worked gently to midwicket
full and slipping down the leg side, Bruce aims a glance, the ball brushes the pad, Nurul dives to his left and collects the ball. No bat involved
opens the face and drives a full ball through cover point
slightly short and outside off, Williamson employs the latest of late cuts and sends the ball down to third man
stump-to-stump line, pushed into the covers
full and angled in on middle, worked to midwicket
flatter and angled in, backs away and forces a single to long-off
slid in with the arm from around the stumps, bunted down to long-on now
down the track, Shakib shortens his length. Bruce adjusts and punches to long-off
slightly short and outside off, moves back, cuts and finds point
Williamson steps away and down the track, driving this inside-out over extra cover for a double
flatter on middle, swept away to deep square leg. Firm hit. Williamson reaches 1000 runs in T20Is
hurries on, flatter and faster, punched down the ground
clipped away through square leg. Sliding into the pads

Williamson stumbles on the second run, sells Bruce down the river. Bruce is caught short at the non-striker's end despite a full-length dive. Back of a length and angled in on off stump, stands tall and punches it to the vacant mid-on region. The two is on. Williamson, however, slips on the second as he turns; he sends the debutant back. He does so really really late. Soumya, meanwhile, hares across to his right from mid-off, hunts the ball down, and throws it to the bowler, who does the rest
good length and angled in on off, wristily flicked through square leg
full on off, pushed to the man at midwicket on the front foot
length ball outside off, right in the slot, de Grandhomme stands tall and clouts it over midwicket for a six
flighted on off, played back to the bowler
pushed outside off, guided wide of short third man
down the track, takes a half-volley, and drives it back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on with a straight bat
tossed up on leg stump, goes low and paddles the ball very fine on the leg side
Williamson shimmies out, dug short and outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
down the track, the bowler sends it very full and outside off. Carved away to third man
full and angling away outside off, driven on the front foot to long-off
back of a length cutter, grips in the surface, lobbed to the leg side
full at at off stump, driven back to the bowler
low full-toss on off, whipped to the right of the leg umpire
slightly short and wide outside off, moves back and laces a cut straight to point

tossed up outside off, Williamson unleashes a slog-sweep in the air. Deep midwicket (Sarkar) is so far inside the boundary; at least 10 yards in. Could have been a regulation catch had he stayed near the edge of the boundary. He back-tracks, but the ball goes over him and plonks for a one-bounce four
shimmies out and works the ball towards midwicket
short on off, chopped hard to backward point
down the track and punches through cover
rank half-tracker on middle. Williamson duly skips back and nails a pull over square leg. Brings up his fifty in style
fractionally short and outside off, sits up to be hit. Pulled powerfully in the air over wide mid-on
full and outside off, drilled to sweeper cover
full again, outside off, driven through extra cover now
short on off, camps back and pulls behind square. Rubel has overstepped
and Williamson takes advantage of it. Full around off, Williamson shuffles across and flicks it away fine of the diving short fine leg fielder
shortish and outside off, stylishly late-cut to third man
off-stump yorker, dug out to cover
wide yorker, opens the face and squirts the ball fine of diving short third man
full on middle, Williamson backs away outside leg and drives it inside out over Kayes at deep extra cover. Skims over the boundary. Kayes like Sarkar was standing inside the boundary too
wide yorker, squeezed out to the third-man fence for a four
De Grandhomme steps out, takes a full-toss and drives, nay smashes it through the covers
full on off, opens the face and drives towards point
back of a length, picked off the pads to deep square leg on the back foot
down the track, meets a very full ball and drags it to wide long-on off the inside half of the bat
full and angling away outside off, driven down to long-off
tucked to midwicket on the back foot
full on off, clipped to mid-on. Williamson and de Grandhomme see off Mustafizur
slightly short and outside off, late-cut down to third man
pretty full on off. Clipped away to long-on
near yorker on off, whipped to long-on
too full on off, drills a drive and finds mid-off
bang. Full on off, too full, lofted with authority over the bowler's head. The flame-throwers burst off

bang bang, de Grandhomme seals the chase with back-to-back boundaries. NZ win with six wickets and two overs to spare. Fractionally short and outside off, de Grandhomme throws his bat at it and scythes the ball over point for a flat six
